013package org.apache.juneau.cp;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.FileUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ObjectUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.internal.IOUtils.*;
021
022import java.io.*;
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.ResourceBundle.*;
025import java.util.concurrent.*;
026import java.util.regex.*;
027
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029
030/**
031 * Basic implementation of a {@link FileFinder}.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Specialized behavior can be implemented by overridding the {@link #find(String, Locale)} method.
035 *
036 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
037 * <p class='bjava'>
038 *    <jk>public class</jk> MyFileFinder <jk>extends</jk> BasicFileFinder {
039 *       <ja>@Override</ja>
040 *       <jk>protected</jk> Optional&lt;InputStream&gt; find(String <jv>name</jv>, Locale <jv>locale</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> IOException {
041 *          <jc>// Do special handling or just call super.find().</jc>
042 *          <jk>return super</jk>.find(<jv>name</jv>, <jv>locale</jv>);
043 *       }
044 *    }
045 * </p>
046 *
047 * <ul class='seealso'>
048 * </ul>
049 */
050public class BasicFileFinder implements FileFinder {
051
052
053   private static final ResourceBundle.Control RB_CONTROL = ResourceBundle.Control.getControl(Control.FORMAT_DEFAULT);
054
055   private final Map<String,LocalFile> files = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
056   private final Map<Locale,Map<String,LocalFile>> localizedFiles = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
057
058   private final LocalDir[] roots;
059   private final long cachingLimit;
060   private final Pattern[] include, exclude;
061   private final String[] includePatterns, excludePatterns;
062   private final int hashCode;
063
064   /**
065    * Builder-based constructor.
066    *
067    * @param builder The builder object.
068    */
069   public BasicFileFinder(FileFinder.Builder builder) {
070      this.roots = builder.roots.toArray(new LocalDir[builder.roots.size()]);
071      this.cachingLimit = builder.cachingLimit;
072      this.include = builder.include;
073      this.exclude = builder.exclude;
074      this.includePatterns = alist(include).stream().map(x->x.pattern()).toArray(String[]::new);
075      this.excludePatterns = alist(exclude).stream().map(x->x.pattern()).toArray(String[]::new);
076      this.hashCode = HashCode.of(getClass(), roots, cachingLimit, includePatterns, excludePatterns);
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Default constructor.
081    *
082    * <p>
083    * Can be used when providing a subclass that overrides the {@link #find(String, Locale)} method.
084    */
085   protected BasicFileFinder() {
086      this.roots = new LocalDir[0];
087      this.cachingLimit = -1;
088      this.include = new Pattern[0];
089      this.exclude = new Pattern[0];
090      this.includePatterns = new String[0];
091      this.excludePatterns = new String[0];
092      this.hashCode = HashCode.of(getClass(), roots, cachingLimit, includePatterns, excludePatterns);
093   }
094
095   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
096   // FileFinder methods
097   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
098
099   @Override /* FileFinder */
100   public final Optional<InputStream> getStream(String name, Locale locale) throws IOException {
101      return find(name, locale);
102   }
103
104   @Override /* FileFinder */
105   public Optional<String> getString(String name, Locale locale) throws IOException {
106      return optional(read(find(name, locale).orElse(null)));
107   }
108
109   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
110   // Implementation methods
111   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
112
113   /**
114    * The main implementation method for finding files.
115    *
116    * <p>
117    * Subclasses can override this method to provide their own handling.
118    *
119    * @param name The resource name.
120    *    See {@link Class#getResource(String)} for format.
121    * @param locale
122    *    The locale of the resource to retrieve.
123    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, won't look for localized file names.
124    * @return The resolved resource contents, or <jk>null</jk> if the resource was not found.
125    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
126    */
127   protected Optional<InputStream> find(String name, Locale locale) throws IOException {
128      name = StringUtils.trimSlashesAndSpaces(name);
129
130      if (isInvalidPath(name))
131         return empty();
132
133      if (locale != null)
134         localizedFiles.putIfAbsent(locale, new ConcurrentHashMap<>());
135
136      Map<String,LocalFile> fileCache = locale == null ? files : localizedFiles.get(locale);
137
138      LocalFile lf = fileCache.get(name);
139
140      if (lf == null) {
141         List<String> candidateFileNames = getCandidateFileNames(name, locale);
142         paths: for (LocalDir root : roots) {
143            for (String cfn : candidateFileNames) {
144               lf = root.resolve(cfn);
145               if (lf != null)
146                  break paths;
147            }
148         }
149
150         if (lf != null && isIgnoredFile(lf.getName()))
151            lf = null;
152
153         if (lf != null) {
154            fileCache.put(name, lf);
155
156            if (cachingLimit >= 0) {
157               long size = lf.size();
158               if (size > 0 && size <= cachingLimit)
159                  lf.cache();
160            }
161         }
162      }
163
164      return optional(lf == null ? null : lf.read());
165   }
166
167   /**
168    * Returns the candidate file names for the specified file name in the specified locale.
169    *
170    * <p>
171    * For example, if looking for the <js>"MyResource.txt"</js> file in the Japanese locale, the iterator will return
172    * names in the following order:
173    * <ol>
174    *    <li><js>"MyResource_ja_JP.txt"</js>
175    *    <li><js>"MyResource_ja.txt"</js>
176    *    <li><js>"MyResource.txt"</js>
177    * </ol>
178    *
179    * <p>
180    * If the locale is <jk>null</jk>, then it will only return <js>"MyResource.txt"</js>.
181    *
182    * @param fileName The name of the file to get candidate file names on.
183    * @param locale
184    *    The locale.
185    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, won't look for localized file names.
186    * @return An iterator of file names to look at.
187    */
188   protected List<String> getCandidateFileNames(final String fileName, final Locale locale) {
189
190      if (locale == null)
191         return Collections.singletonList(fileName);
192
193      List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
194      String baseName = getBaseName(fileName);
195      String ext = getExtension(fileName);
196
197      getCandidateLocales(locale).forEach(x -> {
198         String ls = x.toString();
199         if (ls.isEmpty())
200            list.add(fileName);
201         else {
202            list.add(baseName + "_" + ls + (ext.isEmpty() ? "" : ('.' + ext)));
203            list.add(ls.replace('_', '/') + '/' + fileName);
204         }
205      });
206
207      return list;
208   }
209
210   /**
211    * Returns the candidate locales for the specified locale.
212    *
213    * <p>
214    * For example, if <c>locale</c> is <js>"ja_JP"</js>, then this method will return:
215    * <ol>
216    *    <li><js>"ja_JP"</js>
217    *    <li><js>"ja"</js>
218    *    <li><js>""</js>
219    * </ol>
220    *
221    * @param locale The locale to get the list of candidate locales for.
222    * @return The list of candidate locales.
223    */
224   protected List<Locale> getCandidateLocales(Locale locale) {
225      return RB_CONTROL.getCandidateLocales("", locale);
226   }
227
228   /**
229    * Checks for path malformations such as use of <js>".."</js> which can be used to open up security holes.
230    *
231    * <p>
232    * Default implementation returns <jk>true</jk> if the path is any of the following:
233    * <ul>
234    *    <li>Is blank or <jk>null</jk>.
235    *    <li>Contains <js>".."</js> (to prevent traversing out of working directory).
236    *    <li>Contains <js>"%"</js> (to prevent URI trickery).
237    * </ul>
238    *
239    * @param path The path to check.
240    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the path is invalid.
241    */
242   protected boolean isInvalidPath(String path) {
243      return isEmpty(path) || path.contains("..") || path.contains("%");
244   }
245
246   /**
247    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the file should be ignored based on file name.
248    *
249    * @param name The name to check.
250    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the file should be ignored.
251    */
252   protected boolean isIgnoredFile(String name) {
253      for (Pattern p : exclude)
254         if (p.matcher(name).matches())
255            return true;
256      for (Pattern p : include)
257         if (p.matcher(name).matches())
258            return false;
259      return true;
260   }
261
262   @Override
263   public int hashCode() {
264      return hashCode;
265   }
266
267   @Override /* Object */
268   public boolean equals(Object o) {
269      return o instanceof BasicFileFinder && eq(this, (BasicFileFinder)o, (x,y)->eq(x.hashCode, y.hashCode) && eq(x.getClass(), y.getClass()) && eq(x.roots, y.roots) && eq(x.cachingLimit, y.cachingLimit) && eq(x.includePatterns, y.includePatterns) && eq(x.excludePatterns, y.excludePatterns));
270   }
271
272   @Override /* Object */
273   public String toString() {
274      return filteredMap()
275         .append("class", getClass().getSimpleName())
276         .append("roots", roots)
277         .append("cachingLimit", cachingLimit)
278         .append("include", includePatterns)
279         .append("exclude", excludePatterns)
280         .append("hashCode", hashCode)
281         .asReadableString();
282   }
283}
